data.name: ClusterPath_NonCluster
data.value: The cmdlet could not verify that the path '{0}' can be accessed by the cluster. If the cluster uses a non-Microsoft file system, or you are sure that the path can be accessed by the cluster, run the cmdlet again and use the -AllowUnverifiedPaths parameter to continue.

data.name: VMReplication_ActionNotApplicable_None
data.value: "{0}" is not applicable on virtual machine "{1}".

data.name: VMSan_InitiatorPortNotFound
data.value: An initiator port with node name "{0}" and port name "{1}" could not be found.

data.name: VMRemoteFx3DVideoAdapter_AdapterAlreadyExists
data.value: Hyper-V was unable to perform this operation because the RemoteFX 3D video adapter already exists on this virtual machine. A virtual machine can have only one RemoteFX 3D video adapter.

data.name: InvalidParameter_InvalidClusterObjectType
data.value: The cluster object '{0}' is not a valid cluster group or virtual machine cluster resource. Run the command again and specify an object that represents a cluster group or virtual machine cluster resource.

data.name: VMReplication_NoReplicatedDisk
data.value: There is no supported virtual hard disk to replicate for virtual machine '{0}'.

data.name: InvalidParameter_HashContainsInvalidKeys
data.value: Hash table contains keys that are not valid.

data.name: VMFirmware_Generation1NotSupported
data.value: The Generation 1 virtual machine or snapshot "{0}" does not support the VMFirmware cmdlets. Use Get-VMBios and Set-VMBios instead.

data.name: VMReplication_PrimaryBrokerNotEnabled
data.value: A Hyper-V Replica Broker needs to be created on this failover cluster. Create the Hyper-V Replica Broker using Failover Cluster Manager and try again. If you are using the IsBrokerOptional registry key, retry the operation directly from WMI or through a management suite of your choice.

data.name: VMSan_MissingResource
data.value: The HBA "{0}" is not available through any of the parent resource pools.

data.name: CannotFindDismountedDevice
data.value: Cannot find dismounted assignable device.

data.name: VMGroup_VMType_IncorrectType
data.value: The group specified only permits virtual machines as members of the group not other virtual machine groups.

data.name: InvalidArgument_ReplicaBrokerInvalidPort
data.value: Specified port value "{0}" for "{1}" is not valid. Port value should be within the range 1 to 65535.

data.name: VMGpuPartitionAdapter_NotFound
data.value: Unable to find a Gpu partition adapter matching the given criteria.

data.name: ClusterPath_FailedToVerify
data.value: Windows could not verify that path '{0}' can be accessed by the cluster.

data.name: ClusterPath_NoClusterGroup
data.value: Failed to get the virtual machine's cluster group name.

data.name: VMReplication_ReplicaBrokerNotEnabled
data.value: The specified Replica server is part of a failover cluster. For clusters, a valid Hyper-V Replica Broker is required for the Replica server name. Create the Hyper-V Replica Broker using the Failover Cluster Manager and try again. If you are using the IsBrokerOptional registry key, retry the operation using the recovery cluster node name directly from WMI or through a management suite of your choice.

data.name: VMNotFoundById
data.value: Hyper-V was unable to find a virtual machine with id "{0}".

data.name: VMTPM_NotFound
data.value: TPM device is not found on the virtual machine "{0}".

data.name: VMReplication_KerberosAndCertificatePortsShouldBeDifferent
data.value: Kerberos and Certificate port specified for '{0}' should be different.

data.name: VMReplication_CapNameNotSpecified
data.value: The specified Replica server is part of a failover cluster. For clusters, use the name of the Hyper-V Replica Broker as the Replica server name. The Hyper-V Replica Broker for the cluster is "{0}".

data.name: InvalidParameter_FileNameNotGuid
data.value: The file name provided must be in GUID format.

data.name: VHD_InvalidDiskNumberForVirtualHardDisk
data.value: Windows cannot find a mounted virtual hard disk with the specified disk number.

data.name: InvalidParameter_HashDoesNotContainSource
data.value: Hash tables in the Vhds parameter must contain 'SourceFilePath' key which points to the source virtual hard drive file path.

data.name: OperationFailed_RollbackFailed
data.value: Rolling back the results of an unsuccessful operation has failed.

data.name: VMAssignableDevice_NotFound
data.value: The specified device was not found.

data.name: InvalidArgument_ReplicaNodeExpectingFqdn
data.value: The node "{0}" specified in "{1}" should be a valid fully qualified domain name (FQDN).

data.name: VMResourcePool_ParentPoolNotFound
data.value: One or more parent pools could not be found.

data.name: SnapshotNotFound
data.value: Unable to find a snapshot matching the given criteria.

data.name: VMFloppyDiskDrive_Generation2NotSupported
data.value: Generation 2 virtual machines do not support floppy drives.

data.name: OperationFailed_InvalidState
data.value: The operation cannot be performed while the virtual machine is in its current state.

data.name: PhysicalDvdDrive_NotFound
data.value: Unable to find a physical DVD drive matching the given criteria.

data.name: VMStorageResourcePool_MissingResource
data.value: The path "{0}" is not available through any of the parent resource pools.

data.name: VMReplication_ActionNotApplicableOnPrimary
data.value: "{0}" is not applicable on primary virtual machine "{1}".

data.name: VMRemoteFx3DVideoAdapter_DeviceNotFound
data.value: No device was found by given criteria.

data.name: Warning_VMAlreadyInDesiredState
data.value: The virtual machine is already in the specified state.

data.name: PacketDirect_DoesNotApply
data.value: The packet direct is supported on synthetic network adapters on virtual machines with configuration version 6.2 or above.

data.name: ClusterPath_NotInGroup
data.value: The path '{0}' specifies a disk that is in another cluster group. To move the disk into the virtual machine's cluster group, use the Failover Cluster Manager or the Move-ClusterResource cmdlet.

data.name: DeviceNaming_NotApply
data.value: The device naming setting only applies to synthetic network adapters on Generation 2 virtual machines with configuration version 6.2 or above.

data.name: VMReplication_InvalidPortValue
data.value: Specified port value '{0}' for '{1}' is not valid. Port value should be within the range 1 to 65535.

data.name: VMNotFoundByName
data.value: Hyper-V was unable to find a virtual machine with name "{0}".

data.name: InvalidParameter_VHDIsSharable
data.value: The virtual hard disk '{0}' cannot be moved because it is sharable by multiple virtual machines.

data.name: VMReplication_BrokerResourceNotFound
data.value: The operation cannot be performed because Hyper-V Replica Broker is not configured. Configure the Hyper-V Replica Broker using the Failover Cluster Manager and try again. If you are using the IsBrokerOptional registry key, retry the operation directly from WMI or through a management suite of your choice.

data.name: CannotFindVacantControllerLocation
data.value: The operation could not be completed because no available locations were found on the disk controller.

data.name: VMReplication_SameClusterError
data.value: Cannot replicate virtual machine to the same cluster. Enter another Hyper-V Replica Broker name and try again.

data.name: VMReplication_NodePortMappingNotSpecified
data.value: The ports for the following nodes are not specified in '{1}'. Include these nodes in '{1}' and try again. '{0}'

data.name: VMPciExpressResourcePool_MissingResource
data.value: The PCI Express device "{0}" is not available through any of the parent resource pools.

data.name: VMReplication_PortValueNotSpecified
data.value: Port value is not specified for node '{0}' in '{1}'.

data.name: ClusterPath_FailedToRefreshConfiguration
data.value: The Update-ClusterVirtualMachineConfiguration command could not be completed.

data.name: InvalidParameter_HashDoesNotContainDestination
data.value: Hash tables in the Vhds parameter must contain 'DestinationFilePath' key which points to the destination virtual hard drive file path.

data.name: VMRemoteFx3DVideoAdapter_Synth3dVideoPoolNotFound
data.value: Hyper-V was unable to find WMI object, Synthetic 3D Video Pool, to retrieve necessary information for this operation.

data.name: VMReplication_DomainShouldBeSpecified
data.value: The node '{0}' specified in '{1}' does not contain the domain name '{2}' of the cluster. Correct the name of this node and try again.

data.name: VMReplication_AuthorizationEntryNotFound
data.value: The authorization entry was not found.

data.name: VMScsiController_NotFound
data.value: Unable to find a SCSI controller matching the given criteria.

data.name: VMReplication_ActionNotApplicableOnReplica
data.value: "{0}" is not applicable on Replica virtual machine "{1}".

data.name: PhysicalHardDrive_NotFound
data.value: Unable to find a physical hard drive matching the given criteria.

data.name: VMSwitchExtension_NotFound
data.value: Hyper-V was unable to find a virtual switch extension with name "{0}".

data.name: InvalidParameter_NoPropertyFound
data.value: The type '{0}' does not implement a property with name '{1}'.

data.name: VMSwitch_ExternalPortNotFound
data.value: The external port of virtual switch "{0}" could not be found.

data.name: VMReplication_UniquePortsNotSpecified
data.value: Following ports are specified for multiple nodes. Do you want to continue? '{0}'

data.name: VMReplication_ExpectingFqdn
data.value: The node '{0}' specified in '{1}' should be a valid fully qualified domain name (FQDN).

data.name: VMIntegrationService_IntegrationComponentNotFound
data.value: No integration component with the given name could be found.

data.name: InvalidOperation_DestinationMigrationsAreDisabled
data.value: The destination host is not configured for live migration. Use the Enable-VMMigration cmdlet to modify the Hyper-V settings on the destination host to enable migration.

data.name: InvalidOperation_DownlevelManagementNotSupported
data.value: The Hyper-V module used in this Windows PowerShell session cannot be used for remote management of the server '{0}'. Load a compatible version of the Hyper-V module, or use Powershell remoting to connect directly to the remote server. For more information, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=532650.

data.name: VMReplication_SameHostError
data.value: Cannot replicate virtual machine to the same server. Enter another Replica server name and try again.

data.name: VMReplication_ActionNotApplicableOnTestReplica
data.value: "{0}" is not applicable on virtual machine "{1}" because it is being used for test failover.

data.name: InvalidParameter_MatchesMultipleTemplates
data.value: '{0}' matches more than one secure boot template.

data.name: ClusterPath_AvailableStorage
data.value: The path '{0}' specifies a disk that is still in available storage and has not been moved into the virtual machine's cluster group. To move the disk, use the Failover Cluster Manager or the Move-ClusterResource cmdlet.

data.name: ClusterPath_ConfigurationUpdateCmdletNotInstalledOrLoaded
data.value: The configuration of virtual machine '{0}' was not refreshed within cluster '{1}' because the 'Failover Cluster Module for Windows PowerShell' feature is not enabled. The virtual machine's configuration can be refreshed manually using the Update-ClusterVirtualMachineConfiguration cmdlet or Failover Cluster Manager.

data.name: InvalidOperation_SourceMigrationsAreDisabled
data.value: The source host is not configured for live migration. Use the Enable-VMMigration cmdlet to modify the Hyper-V settings on the source host to enable migration.

data.name: VMFibreChannelHba_WorldWideNameFormatError
data.value: The format of the World Wide Name "{0}" contains an error. Specify the World Wide Name as a value with 16 hexadecimal digits, such as C003FF0000FFFF00.

data.name: VMRemoteFx3DVideoAdapter_DevNotInstalledError
data.value: To enable this device, use Server Manager to install the Remote Desktop Virtualization Host role service.

data.name: InvalidParameter_UnknownFormat
data.value: The format specifier is unknown.

data.name: InvalidOperation_MetricsOnPlannedVMNotSupported
data.value: Resource metering is not supported on virtual machine '{0}' because it is part of a VMCompatibilityReport. Complete the operation used to create the report, and then enable resource metering on the resulting virtual machine.

data.name: VMReplication_ClusterStorageError
data.value: Shared storage must be specified in a clustered environment. Specify a Cluster Shared Volume or shared folder and retry the operation.

data.name: InvalidParameter_HashtableKeyIsNotString
data.value: Hash table key is not a string.

data.name: MoreThanOneSnapshotFound
data.value: More than one snapshot was found matching the given criteria.

data.name: VMResourcePool_MissingResource
data.value: The resource "{0}" is not available through any of the parent resource pools.

data.name: NumaAwarePlacement_DoesNotApply
data.value: The Numa-Aware placement is supported on synthetic network adapters on virtual machines with configuration version 8.4 or above.

data.name: VMRemoteFx3DVideoAdapter_NotGpuCapable
data.value: Hyper-V cannot add a RemoteFX 3D video adapter to this virtual machine. To add this adapter, the host must have at least one graphics processing unit (GPU) that supports RemoteFX and that meets the minimum requirements for DirectX.

data.name: ArgumentOutOfRange_InvalidEnumValue
data.value: '{0}' is not a valid member of the '{1}' enumeration.

data.name: InvalidParameter_VHDIsRDSUserProfileDisk
data.value: The virtual hard disk '{0}' cannot be moved because Remote Desktop Services has flagged it as a user profile disk.

data.name: InvalidOperation_SetVMHostNoParameterProvided
data.value: No changes were made to the host because no parameters were specified. To make changes to the host, run Set-VMHost with one or more parameters.

data.name: VMSwitch_IovSwitchCannotChangeSwitchType
data.value: External virtual switches created with SR-IOV enabled cannot be converted to Internal or Private.

data.name: VMReplication_BrokerResourcePortMappingNotSpecified
data.value: The port for Hyper-V Replica Broker '{0}' is not specified in '{1}'. Include the Hyper-V Replica Broker in the '{1}' and try again.

data.name: VMGroup_VMGroupType_IncorrectType
data.value: The group specified only permits other virtual machines groups as members not virtual machines.

data.name: InvalidOperation_DestinationNetworksAreNotConfigured
data.value: Live migrations of virtual machines cannot be sent to the destination host because no migration networks are specified for incoming live migrations. To specify networks, run the Add-VMMigrationNetwork cmdlet on the destination host. To use any available network for live migration, run the command Set-VMHost -UseAnyNetworkForMigration $true on the destination host.

data.name: Import_InvalidFileName
data.value: The file name at "{0}" is not in GUID format.

data.name: VMIdeController_Generation2NotSupported
data.value: Generation 2 virtual machines do not support IDE.

data.name: VMReplication_ClusterNameSpecified
data.value: The specified Replica server is the name of a failover cluster. For clusters, use the name of the Hyper-V Replica Broker as the Replica server name. Hyper-V Replica Broker for the cluster is "{0}".

data.name: VMNetworkAdapter_ConnectionNotFound
data.value: The network adapter is in an invalid state.

data.name: VMPmemController_NotFound
data.value: Unable to find a PMEM controller matching the given criteria.

data.name: VMBios_Generation2NotSupported
data.value: The Generation 2 virtual machine or snapshot "{0}" does not support the VMBios cmdlets. Use Get-VMFirmware and Set-VMFirmware instead.

data.name: VMSwitch_NotFoundByName
data.value: Hyper-V was unable to find a virtual switch with name "{0}".

data.name: VMEthernetPool_MissingResource
data.value: The virtual Ethernet switch "{0}" is not available through any of the parent resource pools.

data.name: InvalidParameter_MatchesNoTemplates
data.value: '{0}' matches none of the secure boot templates.

data.name: VHD_MountedDiskImageNotFound
data.value: The path "{0}" is not the path to a mounted virtual hard disk file.

data.name: OperationFailed_NotSupportedInClusteredVM
data.value: This operation is not supported on a clustered virtual machine. To perform this operation, remove the virtual machine from the cluster and then try again.

data.name: VMGpuPartitionAdapter_GpuPartitionPoolNotFound
data.value: Hyper-V was unable to find WMI object, Gpu Partition Pool, to retrieve necessary information for this operation.

data.name: VMSwitch_NotFoundInPool
data.value: The resource pool does not contain a virtual switch with name "{0}".

data.name: ClusterPath_NotValid
data.value: The path '{0}' is not a valid path that is accessible to the cluster.
